ARABIC: هَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا ٱلسَّاعَةَ أَن تَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: What are they waiting for, but the Hour to come upon them suddenly when they are not expecting it?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Are they waiting (for any thing) but the Hour (of Doom) which would descend upon them suddenly, and catch them unawares?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Are they awaiting anything other than the Last Hour that it should suddenly come upon them without their even perceiving it?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Are they waiting for the Hour of Doom when the torment will suddenly strike them and they will not even realize from where it came?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: What are they waiting for – except the Last Day, that it may suddenly come upon them while they are unaware?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Do they only wait for the Hour that it shall come upon them suddenly while they perceive not
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Do they wait for aught but the hour, that it should come! upon them all of a sudden while they do not perceive?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Are they looking for aught but the Hour, that it shall come upon them suddenly, when they are not aware?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Await they aught save the Hour, that it shall come upon them suddenly, when they know not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Are they merely waiting for the Hour, which will come upon them suddenly and take them unawares?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They await but the Hour: that it should come upon them of a sudden, while they perceive not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Do they not consider that the Hour may overtake them suddenly while they are unaware?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Do they only wait for the Hour - that it should come on them all of a sudden, while they perceive not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Do they only wait for the Hour that it shall come upon them suddenly, while they perceive not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Are they looking for anything except the Hour (to overtake them). It will come upon them suddenly when they are unaware!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Are they only waiting for the Hour to come upon them suddenly, while they are unaware?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Are they waiting except for the Hour to come upon them suddenly while they perceive not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:66] Are they, that is, the Meccan disbelievers, awaiting anything, that is to say — they are [in fact] awaiting nothing — but that Hour should come upon them (an ta’tiyahum substitutes for al-sā‘ata, ‘the Hour’) suddenly, unexpectedly, while they are unaware?, of the time of its coming beforehand.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Await they) if they do not repent of their claims (aught save the Hour) save the coming of the Hour, (that it shall come upon them suddenly, when they know not) when they are not aware of the descent of punishment upon them?
